name: Vladimir Prendes VI
history:
Vladimir Prendes the sixth of his name hail from the Prendes dynasty who are high ranking nobles of a Karrakin Trade Baronies world that is a tributary of the Union. While living a life of luxury he was always bored and often would throw items at and boss the staff around needlessly. During adolescence he snuck out of his families estate at the same time as a renown lancer was passing through the city where his family held their station and saw the adoration and fame the lancer garnered. This inspired young Vladimir to go down the route to become a lancer. However this caused his father Vladimir Predes the fifth to disown him. Even so he still carries influence over lesser people or so he thinks.

Before his disowning he managed to use his family name to get into a officers academy and while at first disappointed with not being put on track to be a lancer he was soon found to be a natural at piloting mechs causing him to be selected to become a lancer. It was at this time without his knowledge was disowned. The callsign "Charming" was assigned to him by a instructor who found himself saying the word sarcastically almost each time Vladimir opened his mouth and thus became stuck with the name. The most notable attribute of the man was his reaction speed and innate understanding of ballistic calculations.

When dictating the design of his mech he asked for "The biggest possible artillery feasible as is becoming of one of my standing"

mechs.name: Independent Variable
mechs.lastModified: Tue Aug 13 2024 18:00:15 GMT+0200 (Central European Summer Time)

systems.flavorDescription: By installing additional armor plating, redundant firing circuits, and enhanced insulation to magazines the longevity of a frame’s armaments can be greatly enhanced.

integratedSystems.flavorDescription: Gained from the Walking Armory: Rank I pilot talent.

weapon.flavorDescription:
Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-III (T-3) line is made up of heavy weapons, ordnance, and other exotic, specialized, or massive weapons. A broad classification, the T-3 range includes conventional-kinetic anti-materiel rifles, super-rapid cycling pulse rifles, missile racks, cannons, and drone nexuses – “hive”style launchers that serve as miniature factory, hangar, and deployment systems for portable drones. The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.

Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-I (T-1) line is defined by powerful, reliable, and conventional-kinetic ranged and melee weapons, including the GMS assault rifle, heavy machine gun, shotgun, pistol, and various light and heavy blades. Reliable galactic standards, the GMS T-1 line is the most widely used mech-scale line of weaponry across the galaxy. Echoing the Everest’s design notes, T-1 weapons are simply designed, with few (if any) moving parts, intended to be used in or adaptable to any environment.

weapons.flavorDescription: Medium signature weapons are assault rifles, shotguns, pack-fed lasers, or disruption guns.
Medium A/C weapons are typically swords, officer’s sabers, and trench axes.

gear.flavorDescription: “Patch” is pilot slang for any kind of modern first aid gear, including sprayable medi-gel and instant-acting medical patches.

Though their tactical utility is questionable, many pilots set up internal speaker systems in their cockpits. This gives them a clear line to their compatriots during combat, along with the ability to play music.

Designed to protect the wearer’s eyes from intense bursts of light, antiphoton visors are commonly found among breach teams and solar-forward operators. They are effective against flash weapons, intense UV light, and incidental charges from energy weapons.
